js
Class JSUtil

java.lang.Object
  js.JSUtil

public class JSUtil
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides some useful time-saving methods, mostly for working with text.

Version:
1.0.1
Author:
Josh Sunshine

Increases the length of an array by adding empty indexes to the end of the array.

Parameters:

newLength - the new length of the array
Returns:
the original array with extra empty indexes so it has length newLength.

bubbleSort

public static int[] bubbleSort(int[] array,
                               boolean ascending)
Sorts an array of integers into numeric order, either ascending or descending.

Parameters:
array - the array of integers to sort.
ascending - whether the array should be sorted into ascending order or not. If false, descending order is used.
Returns:
the array sorted into the chosen order.

Sorts an array of strings into alphabetical order, either ascending or descending.

array - the array of strings to sort.
ascending - whether the array should be sorted into ascending order or not. If false, descending order is used.
Returns:
the array sorted into the chosen order.

insertionSort

public static int[] insertionSort(int[] array)
Uses the Insertion Sort method to sort an array of integers into ascending order.

See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insertion_sort for information on the Insertion Sort.

Parameters:
array - the array of integers to be sorted into order.
Returns:
the same array, but with the integers sorted into order.

Removes all instances of a substring from within a string.

Returns:
the haystack with all needles removed.

lookupAddress

public static java.lang.String[] lookupAddress(java.lang.String postcode)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
Uses the Google Maps API to lookup the full address of a postcode. Note: This is not 100% accurate and should not be relied on without a backup system.

Parameters:
postcode - the postcode to lookup the address for.
Returns:
an array containing: {street name, area, town, county} in that order.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if something goes wrong contacting Google.

countInstancesOf

public static int countInstancesOf(java.lang.String needle,
                                   java.lang.String haystack)
Counts the number of times a substring appears in a string.

Parameters:
needle - the substring to search for and count.
haystack - the string to search in.
Returns:
the number of times the needle appears in the haystack as an integer.

addRankingSuffix

public static java.lang.String addRankingSuffix(int value)
Adds a 'ranking' suffix to a number - "st", "nd" etc. for creating rankings such as "1st" or "2nd" from an integer.

Parameters:
value - the number to add the suffix to
Returns:
a string containing the number and the suffix

checkForJSLibraryUpdate

public static void checkForJSLibraryUpdate()
Deprecated. The method this uses to check for an update (using http://joshsunshine.me.uk) is going away soon, so get ready to stop using this. The JSLibrary is hosted on GitHub now at http://github.com/jobbogamer/JSLibrary so changelogs and version histories will be readily available there.
